Detailed Description

A spot light Illuminates a dicrete cone in the world.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

spotLight::spotLight (  colorVector    I,
vector3D    d,
double    a
) 
 

Constructor.

Parameters:
I  The intensity of the light emmitted by this light source
d  The direction this light source is facing
a  The angle from d that this light source illuminates (in radians)

Member Function Documentation

colorVector spotLight::getI (  vector3D    L )  [virtual]
 

Returns the intensity of the light.

Parameters:
L  A vector pointing from the point being illuminated to this light
Returns:
A colorVector representing the intensity of the light illuminating the point

Reimplemented from modelLight.

vector3D spotLight::getL (  point3D    P )  [virtual]
 

Returns the location of the light.

Parameters:
P  A 3D point representing the point the light is illuminating
Returns:
A vector pointing from the point, P, to this light

Reimplemented from modelLight.

void spotLight::render (  matrix &    m,
vector< point3D * > &    pointList,
list< polygonRef3D > &    polygonList,
vector< modelLight > &    lightList
)  [virtual]
 

Renders the model.

This steps through the list of modelItems, applying the transforms to the VTM, and recursively calling render on the models, modelPrimatives, lights.

Parameters:
m  The incoming GTM
pointList  The global list of points that will contain all points in the scene once everything has rendered.
polygonList  The global list of polygons that will contain all polygons in the scene once everything has rendered.
lightList  The global list of lights that will contain all lights in the scene once everything has rendered.

Reimplemented from modelLight.
